title: Speed of a parametric function at a specific time

content.question: The position of an object moving along a path in the xy-plane is given by the parametric equations <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>x</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>5</mn><mi>sin</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mi>π</mi><mi>t</mi> </mrow> <mo>)</mo></mrow> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@42AD@</annotation> </semantics> </math> and <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>y</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><msup> <mrow> <mrow><mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mn>2</mn><mi>t</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn> </mrow> <mo>)</mo></mrow> </mrow> <mn>2</mn> </msup> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@40C6@</annotation> </semantics> </math>.
